Class CjxLib

  • java.lang.Object
    • CjxLib

  • public class CjxLib
extends java.lang.Object

    CjxLib is the main class that implements the CloudJunxion API for performing GET, PUT, DEL and LIST operations. Use of the API requires use of the CjxLib constructor for supplying credentials (username/password) as well as a service configuration XML file.

    GET and PUT operations are invoked using the getPutFile() method, DEL (delete) is invoked using the delCloudPath() method, while lsCloudPath() provides the LIST function for listing the contents of a directory. All those functions return an object of type CjxLibOp which encapsulates the thread that performs the actual transfers, including invoking the platform-specific caCspMt.exe engine for the actual interaction with the clouds that constitute the Virtual Private Cloud (VPC).

    Status of an on-going operation can be checked by invoking suitable methods of CjxLibOp.

      No error.

      An unexpected/unknown error occured.
      static int CJXLIB_RC_USER_LOCKOUT
      Access to the user account is currently disallowed which may be due to multiple invalid login attempts, unauthorized usage, payment issues, etc.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CjxLib

        public CjxLib(java.lang.String svcConfigFile,
              java.lang.String userName,
              java.lang.String compName,
              java.lang.String passwd)
       throws CjxLib.CjxLibException

        The constructor for CjxLib authenticates the user of the library and performs the initialization necessary for subsequent GET/PUT/DEL/LIST operations.

        Parameters:
        svcConfigFile - An XML service-configuration file that specifies details of the VPC service. The file has a proprietary format and is typically provided by the admin of the VPC.
        userName - The username of the account used for performing various CjxLib operations.
        compName - The name of the computer used for performing CjxLib operations. The computer name can be null, in which case the operations are all assumed to be performed against Sync folders.
        passwd - The password of the account used for performing CjxLib operations.
        Throws:
        CjxLib.CjxLibException

        The descriptive text string for integer code 'rc'.

      • etsp

        public void etsp(java.lang.String s)
        etsp(): Error Time Stamp Print. Print error message 's' to the console along with a timestamp. The format of the printed output is as follows: {Date} {Time}: Error: CjxLib: {s}
        Parameters:
        s - The error message

      • epnl

        public void epnl(java.lang.String s)
        epnl(): Error Print with Newline. Print error message 's' to the console along with a timestamp. The format * of the printed output is as follows: Error: CjxLib: {s}
        Parameters:
        s - The error message

      • getPutFile

        public CjxLibOp getPutFile(java.lang.String objectPath,
                           java.lang.String localPath,
                           boolean isPut,
                           boolean isSyncFolder,
                           java.lang.String syncFolderName,
                           int verbose)
                    throws CjxLib.CjxLibException
        getPutFile() initates a GET or PUT operation on a new thread and returns an object of type CjxLibOp that encapsulates that thread.
        Parameters:
        objectPath - The path of the object in the cloud. Depending on the value of the 'isSyncFolder' argument, 'objectPath' is relative to a device ('compName' argument specified when invoking the CjxLib constructor) or a sync folder ('syncFolderName' argument).
        localPath - The full path of the local file uploaded (for PUT ) or downloaded (for GET). localPath has to be a valid (existing) file for PUT. In case of GET operations, localPath, if present, gets overwritten with the contents of the object retrieved.
        isPut - TRUE for PUT operations, FALSE for GET operations.
        isSyncFolder - TRUE if the object specified by 'objectPath' is with respect to a Sync folder. FALSE indicates 'objectPath' is under the device specified by the 'compName' argument specified as an argument the CjxLib constructor.
        syncFolderName - If isSyncFolder is TRUE, this should be the name of the Sync folder that 'objectPath' is relative to. Can be null otherwise.
        verbose - Set a value of non-zero for verbose output on the console for debugging purposes.
        Returns:
        Returns an object of type CjxLibOp that encapsulates the thread for performing the requested operation and has methods for monitoring its progress.
        Throws:
        CjxLib.CjxLibException

      • delCloudPath

        public CjxLibOp delCloudPath(java.lang.String objectPath,
                             boolean isSyncFolder,
                             java.lang.String syncFolderName,
                             boolean isDir,
                             int verbose)
                      throws CjxLib.CjxLibException
        delCloudPath() deletes the cloud object specified by 'objectPath'.
        Parameters:
        objectPath - The path of the object in the cloud. Depending on the value of the 'isSyncFolder' argument, 'objectPath' is relative to a device ('compName' argument specified when invoking the CjxLib constructor) or a sync folder ('syncFolderName' argument).
        isSyncFolder - TRUE if the object specified by 'objectPath' is with respect to a Sync folder. FALSE indicates 'objectPath' is under the device specified by the 'compName' argument specified as an argument the CjxLib constructor.
        syncFolderName - If isSyncFolder is TRUE, this should be the name of the Sync folder that 'objectPath' is relative to. Can be null otherwise.
        isDir - TRUE if objectPath refers to a directory in the cloud.
        verbose - Set a value of non-zero for verbose output on the console for debugging purposes.
        Returns:
        Returns an object of type CjxLibOp that encapsulates the thread for performing the requested operation and has methods for monitoring its progress.
        Throws:
        CjxLib.CjxLibException

      • lsCloudPath

        public CjxLibOp lsCloudPath(java.lang.String objectPath,
                            boolean recursive,
                            java.util.AbstractList<ObjInfo> lsResults,
                            boolean isSyncFolder,
                            java.lang.String syncFolderName,
                            int verbose)
                     throws CjxLib.CjxLibException
        lsCloudPath() lists the contents of the cloud path specified by 'objectPath'.
        Parameters:
        objectPath - The path of the object in the cloud. Depending on the value of the 'isSyncFolder' argument, 'objectPath' is relative to a device ('compName' argument specified when invoking the CjxLib constructor) or a sync folder ('syncFolderName' argument).
        recursive - TRUE if the listing should recursively list all subdirectories under the specified object path.
        lsResults - An empty container of type AbstractList that gets populated with entries of type ObjInfo, one per item in the list output.
        isSyncFolder - TRUE if the object specified by 'objectPath' is with respect to a Sync folder. FALSE indicates 'objectPath' is under the device specified by the 'compName' argument specified as an argument the CjxLib constructor.
        syncFolderName - If isSyncFolder is TRUE, this should be the name of the Sync folder that 'objectPath' is relative to. Can be null otherwise.
        verbose - Set a value of non-zero for verbose output on the console for debugging purposes.
        Returns:
        Returns an object of type CjxLibOp that encapsulates the thread for performing the requested operation and has methods for monitoring its progress.
        Throws:
        CjxLib.CjxLibException
